item.title: Of inquiry directing the Secretary of the Treasury to provide to the House of Representatives the tax returns and other specified financial information of President Donald J. Trump.
Of inquiry directing the Secretary of the Treasury to provide to the House of Representatives the tax returns and other specified financial information of President Donald J. Trump.

item.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption
Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

latestAction.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 30.

bill.title: Of inquiry directing the Secretary of the Treasury to provide to the House of Representatives the tax returns and other specified financial information of President Donald J. Trump.

item.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 30.
Reported adversely by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 115-73.
Reported adversely by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 115-73.
Ordered to be Reported Unfavorably by the Yeas and Nays: 24 - 16.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

Directs the Department of the Treasury to provide to the House of Representatives the full tax returns of President Donald J. Trump for tax years 2006-2015, financial documentation, and any information in its possession that specifies President Trump's:

  • debts held by foreign governments and foreign companies;
  • investments in foreign countries and foreign enterprises; and
  • use of any tax shelters, corporate structures, tax avoidance maneuvers, abatements, or other loopholes to reduce or eliminate tax liability.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Directs the Department of the Treasury to provide to the House of Representatives the full tax returns of President Donald J. Trump for tax years 2006-2015, financial documentation, and any information in its possession that specifies President Trump's:

  • debts held by foreign governments and foreign companies;
  • investments in foreign countries and foreign enterprises; and
  • use of any tax shelters, corporate structures, tax avoidance maneuvers, abatements, or other loopholes to reduce or eliminate tax liability.
item.name: Reported to House without amendment

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
